page.title: 16EDUCATION
page.content: The first{school}in Broughton was at the Dowse room. It was a boys' school only; it started about 1640 and was closed down about 1920. There was a{National School}at Chapel lane from 1870 until 1960.{ {Broughton County School}was opened in 1910; it was built to hold 180 pupils. The first headmaster was{Mr Hoare}and he retired in 1943. It was an "all age school" until 1960 when it became a {primary}school. Now the school has three classrooms and a library: there are 58 children on roll. The{uniform}is blue, grey and red. Once a year we have an outing and a sports day. The school hours are 9.00 to 3.30 and we have three playtimes. We have a choir and a recorder group.
